oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Norris Dam located near Knoxville, Tennessee
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This photograph shows Norris Dam that was created as part of the Tennessee Valley Authority project in the 1930s and 1940s.

Norris Dam was TVA's first in a series of dams that harnessed the wild waters of the Tennessee River system to control floods and provide inexpensive electric power. The dam is 1,860 feet in length and 265 feet in height. On top of the dam is U.S. Highway 441 that measures 22 feet in width.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Tennessee Department of Conservation Photograph Collection, 1937-1976
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Tennessee Valley Authority; Dams
Photographs
